items.title: Originalist ‘Bombshell’ Complicates Case on Trump’s Power to Fire Officials
items.summary: As the Supreme Court seems poised to expand the president’s power, a leading scholar whose work the justices have often cited issued a provocative dissent.

items.title: Fragments of 2003 Cable Detail Torture in a Secret C.I.A. Prison
items.summary: An interrogator covertly used a power drill and handgun to menace a prisoner, without permission from the agency’s headquarters.

items.title: Dozens Rescued in Remote Alaskan Villages in Storm That Swept Away Homes
items.summary: The Coast Guard and the Alaska National Guard were conducting search-and-rescue operations in two villages along the Bering Sea on Sunday.

items.title: A Tennessee Sheriff Becomes the Face of Grief After Plant Explosion
items.summary: The blast that killed 16 people has left area residents reeling, including Sheriff Chris Davis of Humphreys County, who has fought back tears in his public briefings.

items.title: 2 Dead After Small Plane Crashes Into Semitrailers Near Texas Airfield
items.summary: It was unknown what led up to the crash on Sunday afternoon near Hicks Airfield outside of Fort Worth.

items.title: Trump Has Not Ruled Out Invoking Insurrection Act to Deploy National Guard, Vance Says
items.summary: Vice President JD Vance asserted in an interview on NBC News’ “Meet the Press” that crime was “out of control” in major U.S. cities.

items.title: Tennessee community mourns 16 killed in munitions plant explosion
items.summary: <p>Cause of explosion at Accurate Energetic Systems that leveled building is unknown but foul play ruled out</p><p>At least 200 mourners came to the Humphreys county courthouse at twilight on Sunday to mourn the 16 people killed in an explosion at a nearby munitions plant in middle Tennessee early on Friday.</p><p>Humphreys county sheriff Chris Davis said that even in these nightmarish days, “the true strength of our county is our people”.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/13/tennessee-munitions-plant-explosion">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Growing number of US veterans face arrest over Ice raid protests
items.summary: <p>Veterans are facing federal charges after protesting Ice sweeps and Trump’s national guard deployments. The justice department claims the veterans were violent</p><p>US military veterans increasingly face arrest and injury amid protests over<strong> </strong>Donald Trump’s deportation campaign and his push to deploy national guard members to an ever-widening number of American cities.</p><p>The Guardian has identified eight instances where military veterans have been prosecuted or sought damages after being detained by federal agents.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/13/us-veterans-protest-ice-raids">Continue reading...</a>
